intro: Dodecatheon lutescens, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in open, sunlit environments. Its leaves are usually basal, arranged in a rosette, and are covered in fine hairs. Dodecatheon lutescens is often found in alpine or subalpine regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
